DOC.brief_summary: Intellectual disability (ID) occurs in 2 to 3 % of the general population but the cause is identified only in 30 to 60% of cases. The purpose of this study is to indentify genes involved in ID with new genetics tools (SNP-arrays, next generation sequencing...) and establish genotype-phenotype correlations.
DOC.brief_title: Research and Characterization of New Genes Involved in Intellectual Disability
DOC.criteria: for the patients: Clinical diagnosis of intellectual disbility for the unaffected sibs: to be aged at least 3 years informed consent absence of informed consent
